Posts.Content: That's good. Thanks for your info, remmus52. It's not clear to me that it will prevent the recurrence of bc from the matectomy breast or prevent another breast from developing bc. It's hard to decide whether to take Tamoxifen or not.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Thanks for the info. I went to the websit from the link you posted here and I was impressed by Avemar's efficacy. Is Avemar a prescription medicine? Where can you buy it?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Can anyone give me any suggestion on whether taking Tamoxifen or any other drugs after mastectomy? I had mastectomy surgery four months ago since I had ductal carcinoma in situ(DCIS, stage o breast cancer). After the surgery, I went to see an oncologist. The oncologist suggested me to take tamoxifen for five years. And I was told about the side effects of may getting uterine cancer. I'm still hesitating to take tamoxifen. But I'm scared of the recurrence of the bc. Does anyone have the same situation as mine? What should I do? Any input would be greately appreciated.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Hi Tre, How are you? You've posted a lot of good advices here. But I haven't seen you for a while recently. Just check in with you. Hope everything is fine with you. Lucy
Posts.Title: Hi Tre, How are you?
